This package provides classes to represent and read Bayesian networks.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
This package provides classes to represent and read Bayesian networks. Most classes have a main() method that does something useful or illustrative.

Representation

  • BayesianNetwork: A Bayesian network consisting of Nodes corresponding to RandomVariables, links between nodes, and a conditional probability table (CPT) associated with each node.
  • RandomVariable: A random variable, with its Domain of possible values (or outcomes).
  • Domain: A domain of possible values (outcomes) for a RandomVariable.
  • CPT: A conditional probability table stored at a node in a BayesianNetwork, representing the conditional probability distribution of the node's RandomVariable given its parents.

Input/Output

  • XMLBIFParser: DOM Parser for the XMLBIF format for BayesianNetworks.
  • CPTFormatException: Exception thrown when reading the CPT in an XMLBIFParser.

Inference

  • Distribution: Represents the probability distribution of a single RandomVariable. This is what is returned by the various inference algorithms.
  • Assignment: A set of RandomVariables and their assigned values. This is used to represent the evidence vector in a Bayesian network inference problem, for example.
  • EnumerationInferencer: Implementation of the depth-first inference by enumeration algorithm from AIMA Figure 14.9.
  • PriorSampler: Implementation of the PRIOR-SAMPLE algorithm from AIMA Figure 14.13.
  • RejectionSamplingInferencer: Implementation of the rejection sampling algorithm from AIMA Figure 14.14.

Utility Classes

  • ArraySet:
  • Printable:
